security: Disclosing that Boris D. TARASOFF and his family are known to be CIA and known by USSR representatives could expose him and his family to potential harm and compromise ongoing intelligence operations. Quoting directly: "Mr. TARASOFF and his family are known to be CIA; and, further, are known by USSR representatives whom he served as interpreter/translator in the U.S."
summary: A memo outlines the security clearance granted to Mr. Boris D. TARASOFF for PCS to Mexico City, noting that WHD acknowledges he and his family are known to be CIA and recognized by USSR representatives.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated 28 May 1963, addresses the security clearance for Mr. Boris D. TARASOFF's Permanent Change of Station (PCS) to Mexico City. The Office of Security has granted the clearance with the proviso that WHD (presumably a division within the CIA) recognizes that TARASOFF and his family are known to be CIA operatives and are also known by representatives of the USSR, whom TARASOFF served as an interpreter/translator, ostensibly under cover as a Department of State or U.S. Government contract employee. W. S. RENEHAN of WH/Pers indicates that WHD is aware and accepts this condition, ensuring C/WH/3 is informed.
title: Mr. Boris D. TARASOFF, PCS Security Clearance
